g.text: Moreover, 18:3 is a metabolic precursor for long-chain polyunsaturated fatty acids (LC-PU-
, ω-3). They are essential constituents of human nutrition,
and play key roles in brian and cardiovascular health [
EPA and DHA is the marine product, especially fish oil [
In higher plants, fatty acids are synthesized
in the stroma of plastids through a com-
plex series of condensation reactions to produce either C16 or C18 fatty acids. These fatty
acids are then incorporated into the two glycerolipid synthetic pathways: the prokaryotic path-
]. Chloroplast galactolipids contain substantial amounts of
trienoic fatty acid, either the hexatrienoic acid (16:3) or 18:3, which may vary in different plant
]. In both glycerol pathways, desaturation of fatty acids is performed by a series of
membrane-bound desaturases of the chloroplast and the endoplasmic reticulum(ER) [
Fatty acid desaturases are encoded by nuclear genes and differ in the substrate specificity
and subcellular localization, and play critical roles in maintaining proper structure and cellular
]. Stearoyl ACP desaturase (SAD) is the only soluble
desaturase, which convertes stearoyl-ACP (18:0-ACP) to oleic acid (18:1-ACP) by introducing
the first double bond at the 9
position fromthe carboxylic end of the fatty acyl chain in the
]. Furhter desaturations are carried out by membrane-
bound desaturases in the ER (FAD2 and FAD3) and the chloroplast (FAD4, FAD5, FAD6,
FAD7, and FAD8) as we mentioned before. FAD2 and FAD6 are ω-6 desaturases that synthe-
size linolenic acid (18:2) fromoleic acid (18:1) by introduction of a double bond at the 12
position fromthe ω end in the ER and plastid, respectively.
While, FAD3, FAD7, and FAD8 are ω-3 desaturases that desaturase 18:2 to 18:3 by inserting a
gene encodes a plastidial ω-3 desaturase that is cold-inducible, which can com-
FAD5 synthesize 16:1 from16:0 specifically for the main component of chloroplast membrane
The genes encoding ω-3 fatty acid desaturases have been identified and studied fromseveral
enzymes have been shown to be the major contributors to seed 18:3 content in Arabidopsis,
]. On the contrary, the overexpression of a chloroplast ω-3 fatty
acid desaturase was demonstrated to enhance the tolerance to low temperatures [
thermore, overexpression of ω-3 fatty acid desaturases
in tomato enhanced resistance to cold stress, and altered
fatty acid composition with an increase in the 18:3/18:2 ratio in leaves and fruits [
Increased desaturation of glycerolipids severs as compensation to cold-caused decrease in
]. Thus, plant desaturases are very sensitive to several environmental
cues such as temperature, light, or other factors [
Jacq.) is the most productive oil-bearing crop in the world [
It is native to West Africa, but is now grown thuoughout the humid tropical lowlands [
There are two major economic productions fromoil palmfruits: palmoil extracted fromthe
mesocarp and palmkernel oil fromthe endosperm[
45%), linoleate (18:2; 8%), and 47%saturated fatty acid (43%of 16:0 and 4%of 18:0). There-
fore, much effort has been made to understand the oil synthesis in oil palmfruits and improve
the fatty acid composition of palmoil since the high content of saturated fatty acid has been
thought to be unhealthy to human [
palmhas been tested in yeast, and it produced about 12%of linoleic acid in yeast, which barely

publish, or preparation of the manuscript.
